title: Derived Madd
desc1_desc: Madd Far'i refers to the elongation of a recitation due to the presence of a Hamzah (همزة) or a Sukoon (سكون).
desc2_desc: Derived Madd is divided into multiple categories depending on the cause of elongation, such as Hamzah or Sukoon, and includes specific rules for their application.

Lessons.name: Extension Due to Hamzah
Lessons.pengertian: Occurs when Hamzah interacts with Madd letters in various configurations. This includes specific types based on the interaction within or between words.

rules.name: Madd Badal
rules.description: Occurs when a Hamzah precedes a Madd letter. Originally, the word contains two Hamzah letters, but one is transformed into a Madd for easier pronunciation.

rules.name: Madd Wajib Muttasil
rules.description: When Madd Aslī meets a Hamzah in the same word, the recitation must be elongated.

rules.name: Madd Jaiz Munfasil
rules.description: If Madd Aslī in one word connects to a Hamzah in the next word, the elongation can vary. Consistency in duration is required throughout the session.

rules.name: Madd Silah Thawīlah
rules.description: Occurs when a Ha' Dhamir (ه) is followed by a Hamzah in the next word.

Lessons.name: Extension Due to Sukoon
Lessons.pengertian: Occurs when Madd Aslī is followed by a Sukoon or Shaddah, requiring longer elongation.

rules.name: Madd Lazim Mutsaqqal Kalimi
rules.description: Occurs when Madd Aslī is followed by a Shaddah within the same word.

rules.name: Madd Lazim Mukhaffaf Kalimi
rules.description: Happens when Madd Aslī meets a Sukoon within a word.

rules.name: Madd Farqi
rules.description: When a Madd Badal is followed by a letter with Shaddah.

Lessons.name: Extension Due to Sukoon and Waqf
Lessons.pengertian: Occurs when Madd interacts with Sukoon and is influenced by the stopping point (Waqf).

rules.name: Madd Leen
rules.description: When pausing on a word where the second-to-last letter is a Leen letter (a و or ي after a Fat-hah).

rules.name: Madd Aridh Lis-Sukoon
rules.description: When a Madd is followed by a Sukoon due to stopping.

Take a breath after reciting ل
